result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent T Wiswell

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Timelines
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Comply with any IID order. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.

Defendant Brent T Wiswell in court, in custody.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Brent T Wiswell.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Uzowulu, parties have a stipulation. Must post $1000 cash. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Brent T Wiswell in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Brent T Wiswell.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bond motion to be filed by business end on Friday, 10/07/2022. Minutes filed.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Brent T Wiswell appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Brent T Wiswell. State Public Defender needs more time to appoint. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*See new bond set 10/10/22*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Comply with any IID order. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Case called at 1:51 PM. Defendant Brent T Wiswell in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared for bond purposes. Discussion as to bond. History by ADA Berg. Response by Attorney Hagerman. Defendant responds to court's questions as to attorney. He will hire his own. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
